enumValues.name: CLEAN
enumValues.description: The attachment is clean and safe to download.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The virus scan failed.

enumValues.name: INFECTED
enumValues.description: The attachment is infected and should not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The virus scan is still pending.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: BooleanSetting
types.description: A boolean setting

fields.name: booleanValue
fields.description: The value of the setting. This is named uniquely (instead of just `value`) so that the union has unique fields.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The setting code.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: The scope of the setting.

types.name: BusinessHours
types.description:
Represents the times in which you are open for business during a week. If a day is null, it means that day you are not
open for business.

inputFields.name: endTime
inputFields.description: The time you close for business on this day as an UTC ISO time. For example: 17:00Z .

inputFields.name: startTime
inputFields.description: The time you open for business on this day as an UTC ISO time. For example: 09:00Z .

types.name: BusinessHoursWeekDaysInput
types.description: Represents the times in which you are open for business during a week. Only provide the days you are open for business.

inputFields.name: isDeleted
inputFields.description:
True to only return companies that have been deleted. False to only return companies that have not been deleted.
Omit to return all companies.

types.name: CompaniesSearchQuery
types.description: Query to search for companies.

inputFields.name: term
inputFields.description:
The term to search for. It must be at least 2 characters long. The search is case-insensitive on these two fields:
- the company name (partial match)
- the company domain name (partial match)

inputFields.name: companyDomainName
inputFields.description: The domain name of the company (e.g. plain.com). Alternatively, you can provide a full URL (e.g. https://www.plain.com) and we will do our best to extract the domain name.

inputFields.name: companyId
inputFields.description: Plain's internal identifier for the company.

inputFields.name: payload
inputFields.description: JSON-encoded payload of the service configuration.

inputFields.name: badgeLabel
inputFields.description: The label of the badge. Maximum 500 characters.

inputFields.name: containerContent
inputFields.description: Must contain at least one component.

inputFields.name: copyButtonTooltipLabel
inputFields.description: The tooltip label. Maximum 500 characters.

inputFields.name: copyButtonValue
inputFields.description: The value to be copied. Maximum 1000 characters.

inputFields.name: linkButtonLabel
inputFields.description: The label of the button. Maximum 500 characters.

inputFields.name: linkButtonUrl
inputFields.description: Must be a valid URL.

inputFields.name: plainText
inputFields.description: The text content, without markdown support. Must be between 1 and 5000 characters.

inputFields.name: rowMainContent
inputFields.description: Must contain at least one component.

fields.name: size
fields.deprecationReason: Use spacerSize instead, which has the same type

inputFields.name: spacerSize
inputFields.description: Required input, will be made required after deprecated fields are removed.

fields.name: color
fields.deprecationReason: Use textColor instead, which has the same type

fields.name: size
fields.deprecationReason: Use textSize instead, which has the same type

inputFields.name: text
inputFields.description: The text content, with markdown support. Must be between 1 and 5000 characters.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER
enumValues.description: A channel that Plain tracks for customer support requests.

enumValues.name: DISCUSSION
enumValues.description: A channel that Plain tracks for internal team discussions.

fields.name: attachmentVirusScanResult
fields.description: The result of the virus scan on this attachment. If this is null, it means that your workspace does not have virus scan checks enabled.

types.name: CreateCustomerCardConfigInput
types.description:
Input type to create a new customer card config.

By default new customer cards will have an ordering of 100000 (to place them at the bottom).

inputFields.name: apiHeaders
inputFields.description: An array of headers name-value pairs (maximum length of array: 20).

inputFields.name: apiUrl
inputFields.description: The URL from which this card should be loaded (must start with `https://` and be a valid URL, max length: 600 characters).

inputFields.name: defaultTimeToLiveSeconds
inputFields.description: The default time the card should be cached for if no TTL is provided in the card response. (minimum: 15 seconds, maximum: 1 year or  31,536,000 seconds).

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: The key of the card (must be unique in a workspace, max length: 500 characters, must match regex: `[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`).

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the card (max length: 500 characters).

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The created customer card config.

inputFields.name: components
inputFields.description: The components used to create the event's contents.

inputFields.name: customerIdentifier
inputFields.description: The customer id of the customer that the event is for.

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: The external ID of this event. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this event. This must be unique.

inputFields.name: timestamp
inputFields.description: When provided, this will override the timestamp of the event. Useful when backfilling events. Must be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the event.

inputFields.name: parentHelpCenterArticleGroupId
inputFields.description: Parent group ID. If not provided, creates a top-level group.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of machine user. Defaults to API_USER if not specified.

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: Used to group snippets, only accepts alphanumeric characters

types.name: CreateThreadAssignedToInput
types.description: Only one of the fields can be set.

inputFields.name: components
inputFields.description: The components used to create the event's contents.

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: The external ID of this event. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this event. This must be unique.

inputFields.name: threadId
inputFields.description: The thread id of the thread that the event is for.

inputFields.name: timestamp
inputFields.description: When provided, this will override the timestamp of the event. Useful when backfilling events. Must be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the event.

inputFields.name: assignedTo
inputFields.description: User or machine user this thread should be assigned to.

inputFields.name: attachmentIds
inputFields.description: An array of attachments for the first timeline entry in the thread.
inputFields.deprecationReason: Use sendChat and sendCustomerChat mutations instead. Both allow you to backdate messages.

inputFields.name: channel
inputFields.description: The channel to create the thread for. Currently supported: API, EMAIL, SLACK, MS_TEAMS, or CHAT. Defaults to API.

inputFields.name: channelDetails
inputFields.description: Channel details for the thread, required if channel is SLACK or MS_TEAMS

inputFields.name: components
inputFields.description: The components used to create the first timeline entry in the thread.
inputFields.deprecationReason: Use sendChat and sendCustomerChat mutations instead. Both allow you to backdate messages.

inputFields.name: customerIdentifier
inputFields.description: The identifier of the customer being either the existing customer ID, the customer's email address or and external ID.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description:
The optional description for this thread. This is used to display a preview of the thread in the UI.
If not provided, we will automatically infer it from the components you provided.

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: The external ID of this thread. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this thread.

inputFields.name: labelTypeIds
inputFields.description: An array of label types to attach to the thread upon creation.

inputFields.name: priority
inputFields.description: The priority of the thread. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3, from most to least urgent, defaults to 2 (normal).

inputFields.name: tenantIdentifier
inputFields.description: A thread may be assigned to a specific tenant.

inputFields.name: threadFields
inputFields.description: An array of thread fields to attach to the thread upon creation.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the thread.

inputFields.name: color
inputFields.description: The color to assign to this tier, given by its hex code (e.g. #FABADA). This color is used in Plain's UI to represent this tier.

inputFields.name: defaultThreadPriority
inputFields.description: Any thread created in this tier will have this priority by default, unless a different priority is specified while creating it. If not provided, it defaults to 2 (normal priority).

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: The external ID of this tier. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this tier. This must be unique in your workspace.

inputFields.name: isDefault
inputFields.description:
If set to true, this tier will be applied to all threads that do not match any other tier.

Only one tier can be the default tier.

Default: false

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of this tier.

inputFields.name: payload
inputFields.description: JSON-encoded payload of the rule definition.

types.name: Customer
types.description:
The core customer entity. A customer only exists (ideally) once.
Uniqueness is guaranteed on both of these fields:
1. `externalId` if provided
2. `email`

fields.name: assignedAt
fields.description: When the customer was assigned to a user.

fields.name: assignedToUser
fields.description: The user the customer is assigned to.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: The avatar URL of the customer.

fields.name: company
fields.description: The company the customer belongs to.

fields.name: customerGroupMemberships
fields.description: A subquery to fetch the customer's group memberships.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: Your system's ID for this customer.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: The full name of the customer.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Uniquely identifies a customer in Plain.

fields.name: shortName
fields.description: An optional short name of the customer, typically their first name.

fields.name: tenantMemberships
fields.description: A subquery to fetch the customer's tenants.

types.name: CustomerCardConfig
types.description:
The configuration of a customer card that defines four important things:

- The title of the card
- The key of the card, which will be used in the request payload to the API URL
- The order in which the cards should appear
- Which API the card should be loaded from (and the required authentication headers)

Configs that have the same API URL and API Headers will be loaded in batch. API header names are treated case insensitively.

A maximum of 25 customer cards can be configured.

fields.name: apiHeaders
fields.description: An array of headers name-value pairs (maximum length of array: 20). Requires the `customerCardConfigApiDetails:read` permission.

fields.name: apiUrl
fields.description: The URL from which this card should be loaded (must start with `https://` and be a valid URL, max length: 600 characters). Requires the `customerCardConfigApiDetails:read` permission.

fields.name: defaultTimeToLiveSeconds
fields.description: The default time the card should be cached for if no TTL is provided in the card response. (minimum: 15 seconds, maximum: 1 year or  31,536,000 seconds).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the customer card config.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: Indicates if the customer card is enabled or not. Disabled customer card configs are not loaded or displayed for customers.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key of the card (must be unique in a workspace, max length: 500 characters, must match regex: `[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`).

fields.name: order
fields.description:
The order in which this customer card config should be shown.

Duplicate order numbers are allowed, in case the order is the same they will be sorted based on `id`. The minimum is 0 and the maximum is 100000.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the card (max length: 500 characters).

types.name: CustomerCardConfigApiHeader
types.description: An API header that will be sent to the configured API URL.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the header, trimmed and treated case insensitively for deduplication purposes (min length: 1, max length: 100). Not all header names are allowed.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the header, treated case sensitively for deduplication purposes (min length: 1, max length: 500).

types.name: CustomerCardConfigApiHeaderInput
types.description: An API header that will be sent to the configured API URL.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the header, trimmed and treated case insensitively for deduplication purposes (min length: 1, max length: 100). Not all header names are allowed.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The value of the header, treated case sensitively for deduplication purposes (min length: 1, max length: 500).

inputFields.name: customerCardConfigId
inputFields.description: The ID of the customer card config to be reordered.

inputFields.name: order
inputFields.description: The order the customer card config should have.

types.name: CustomerCardInstance
types.description:
A shared interface for all common properties customer card instances can have.
A customer can only have one customer card instance for each customer card config at any point in time.

Has 3 implementations:
- `CustomerCardInstanceLoading`
- `CustomerCardInstanceLoaded`
- `CustomerCardInstanceError`

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The customer card config this instance is for.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer the instance is for.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the customer card instance. A new ID is generated for each load.

fields.name: threadId
fields.description: The thread the instance is for. Null if this card is not loaded in a thread context.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceCardTooBigErrorDetail
types.description: The card exceeded the maximum allowed size.

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The customer card config this instance is for.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer the instance is for.

fields.name: errorDetail
fields.description: The details of the customer card load error.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the customer card instance. A new ID is generated for each load.

fields.name: threadId
fields.description: The thread the instance is for. Null if this card is not loaded in a thread context.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceErrorDetail
types.description: Details for the reasons why the customer card failed to load.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceLoaded
types.description: A loaded customer card.

fields.name: components
fields.description: The list of components of the customer card. If this is null it means the customer card was returned on the API, but the components array was empty.

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The customer card config this instance is for.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer the instance is for.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the customer card instance. A new ID is generated for each load.

fields.name: loadedAt
fields.description: When the customer card was received from the API.

fields.name: threadId
fields.description: The thread the instance is for. Null if this card is not loaded in a thread context.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceLoading
types.description:
A loading customer card. The createdAt timestamp indicates when the load was started.
Will be updated to be a CustomerCardInstanceLoaded or CustomerCardInstanceError.

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The customer card config this instance is for.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer the instance is for.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the customer card instance. A new ID is generated for each load.

fields.name: threadId
fields.description: The thread the instance is for. Null if this card is not loaded in a thread context.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceMissingCardErrorDetail
types.description: The configured API URL didn't return a requested card key.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceRequestErrorDetail
types.description: Plain failed to make the request to the configured API URL.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceResponseBodyErrorDetail
types.description: An invalid response body was returned from the configured API URL.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceStatusCodeErrorDetail
types.description: A non-200 status code was returned from the configured API URL.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceTimeoutErrorDetail
types.description: The card failed to load within the timeout.

types.name: CustomerCardInstanceUnknownErrorDetail
types.description: An unknown error occurred. If this error is persistent, please contact our support.

fields.name: components
fields.description: The list of components of the event.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The datetime when this event was created.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The actor who created this event.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer that this event belongs to.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the event.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The datetime when this event was last updated.

fields.name: updatedBy
fields.description: The actor who last updated this event.

types.name: CustomerIdentifierInput
types.description: Only one of the fields can be set.

types.name: CustomerSearchCondition
types.description:
The customer attributes available for search, each of them mapped to a search expression.
Exactly one of them must be provided in a single search condition.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: Search expression on the customer's email address.

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: Search expression on the customer's external id.

inputFields.name: fullName
inputFields.description: Search expression on the customer's full name.

inputFields.name: shortName
inputFields.description: Search expression on the customer's short name.

inputFields.name: timelineEntryText
inputFields.description:
Search expression on specific timeline entries' text (email, chat) sent or received by the customer.
Common English stop-words will be removed from the text to search.

inputFields.name: companyIdentifiers
inputFields.description:
Filters customers to those belonging to the given companies.
Customers who dont belong to any of the given companies will not be included.
Can be combined with other company filters.

inputFields.name: customerGroupIds
inputFields.description:
Filters customers to those with at least one of the given customer group IDs.
Customers with no groups will not be included.
Can be combined with other group filters.

inputFields.name: customerGroupKeys
inputFields.description:
Filters customers to those with at least one of the given customer group keys.
Customers with no groups will not be included.
Can be combined with other group filters.

inputFields.name: tenantIdentifiers
inputFields.description:
Filters customers to those belonging to the given tenants.
Customers who dont belong to any of the given tenants will not be included.
Can be combined with other company filters.

types.name: CustomersSearchQuery
types.description:
A query to search for customers. Search queries are combinations of search conditions, as defined
below. At least one search condition must be provided.

inputFields.name: or
inputFields.description: An array of search conditions that will be combined using a 'logical OR' to search for customers.

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description: Timestamps -greater or equal- than this value. ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description: Timestamps -less- than this value. ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: customerCardConfigId
inputFields.description: The customer card config ID to delete.

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description: An object modelling an email address and if it's been verified.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address.

fields.name: isVerified
fields.description: If the email address ownership has been verified (e.g. via sending an email with a code). If the email is not verified, Plain may not email this address.

fields.name: verifiedAt
fields.description: When the email became verified in Plain.

fields.name: attachments
fields.description: All the attachments included in this email.

fields.name: bounces
fields.description: If any of the recipients bounces the email, this will contain the list of bounces.

fields.name: category
fields.description: The category of the email.

fields.name: fullMarkdownContent
fields.description: The full email's markdown content, including all replies.

fields.name: fullTextContent
fields.description: The full email's text content, including all replies.

fields.name: hasMoreMarkdownContent
fields.description: Boolean indicating whether there is more markdown content available that can be resolved via the `fullMarkdownContent` field.

fields.name: hasMoreTextContent
fields.description: Boolean indicating whether there is more text content available that can be resolved via the `fullTextContent` field.

fields.name: isStartOfThread
fields.description: Whether this email entry is the start of a new thread in Plain. Can be used to show the full email content.

fields.name: markdownContent
fields.description: The most recent email's markdown content.

fields.name: receivedAt
fields.description: When the email was received by Plain.

fields.name: sendStatus
fields.description: Informs whether the email was sent successfully, bounced or failed. If the email is still being sent, the status will be 'PENDING'. Only set for outbound emails.

fields.name: sentAt
fields.description: When the email was sent. Only set for outbound emails and will be null until the email is sent.

fields.name: textContent
fields.description: The most recent email's text content.

enumValues.name: BOUNCED
enumValues.description: Some (or all) of the recipients bounced the email, meaning they did not recieve it. Check 'bounces' for more details on which recipients bounced.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The email failed to send. This will happen if the main recipient (To) bounced the email, or if there was an unexpected error sending the email.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The email is being sent.

enumValues.name: SENT
enumValues.description: The email was sent successfully to all recipients.

types.name: Entry
types.description: A union of all possible entries that can appear in a timeline.

fields.name: firstResponseTimeMinutes
fields.description: This SLA will breach if it does not receive a first response within this many minutes.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: articleGroups
fields.description: All article groups in the help center.

fields.name: articles
fields.description: All articles in the help center.

fields.name: articleGroup
fields.description: The group this article belongs to, if any.

fields.name: articles
fields.description: Direct articles in this group.

fields.name: childArticleGroups
fields.description: Direct child groups under this group.

fields.name: parentArticleGroup
fields.description: Parent group in the hierarchy. Null for top-level groups.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: position
fields.description: The position of the label type. Always relative to its parent.

types.name: LinearIssueStateType
types.description:
Represents the possible states of a Linear issue, sourced from the Linear API.
Reference: https://studio.apollographql.com/public/Linear-API/variant/current/schema/reference/objects/WorkflowState#type

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Placeholder for unknown or unsupported future states from Linear.

fields.name: nextLinearStateId
fields.description: Refers to the id of the WorkflowState object in Linear. This can be used to fetch the WorkflowState from the Linear API.

fields.name: previousLinearStateId
fields.description: Refers to the id of the WorkflowState object in Linear. This can be used to fetch the WorkflowState from the Linear API.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of machine user. Defaults to API_USER if not specified during creation.

enumValues.name: AI_AGENT
enumValues.description: A machine user that represents an AI Agent

enumValues.name: API_USER
enumValues.description: A machine user that interacts via API

inputFields.name: afterLabelTypeId
inputFields.description: Move the label type immediately after the label type with the given ID. Required if beforeLabelTypeId is not provided.

inputFields.name: beforeLabelTypeId
inputFields.description: Move the label type immediately before the label type with the given ID. Required if afterLabelTypeId is not provided.

inputFields.name: parentLabelTypeId
inputFields.description: Move the label type to be a child of the specified parent. When provided alone, the label will be moved to the end of the parent's children. When provided with afterLabelTypeId or beforeLabelTypeId, validates that the reference label has the same parent.

fields.name: addCustomerToCustomerGroups
fields.description: Add a customer to a customer group.

fields.name: createCustomerCardConfig
fields.description: Creates a customer card config. A maximum of 25 card configs can be created.

fields.name: createCustomerEvent
fields.description: Create a new customer event.

fields.name: createCustomerGroup
fields.description: Create a new customer group.

fields.name: createThreadEvent
fields.description: Create a new thread event.

fields.name: createWebhookTarget
fields.description: Creates a webhook target.

fields.name: deleteCustomer
fields.description: Deletes a customer and all of their data stored on Plain. This action cannot be reversed.

fields.name: deleteCustomerCardConfig
fields.description: Deletes a customer card config.

fields.name: deleteCustomerGroup
fields.description: Delete a customer group by ID.

fields.name: deleteMyServiceAuthorization
fields.description: Delete personal service authorizations for the current user.

fields.name: deleteServiceAuthorization
fields.description: Delete the workspace service authorization.

fields.name: deleteWebhookTarget
fields.description: Deletes a webhook target.

fields.name: markCustomerAsSpam
fields.description: Marks a customer as spam.

fields.name: reloadCustomerCardInstance
fields.description:
Reloads a customer card for a customer.

Will discard whatever is in the cache and reload it from the configured API URL.

fields.name: removeCustomerFromCustomerGroups
fields.description: Remove a customer from a customer group.

fields.name: reorderCustomerCardConfigs
fields.description:
Reorders customer card configs.

The input can be a partial input and in that case not all configs will be reordered.
For example this allows two configs to be swapped with each other.

Note: Duplicate orders are allowed by the API.

fields.name: replyToThread
fields.description:
Reply to the last message in a thread. This mutation supports replying to threads where the last message is
a Slack message, an email or a form submission. If the thread is empty, it will send an email to the customer.

fields.name: resolveCustomerForSlackChannel
fields.description: Resolves a customer for a Slack channel by finding or creating a customer associated with one of the Slack users in the channel.

fields.name: toggleSlackMessageReaction
fields.description: Adds or removes a reaction from a slack message timeline entry.

fields.name: unmarkCustomerAsSpam
fields.description: Removes the spam mark from a customer.

fields.name: updateCustomerCardConfig
fields.description: Partially updates a customer card config.

fields.name: updateCustomerCompany
fields.description: Changes the company of a customer.

fields.name: updateCustomerGroup
fields.description: Update a customer group.

fields.name: updateSetting
fields.description: Updates a setting.

fields.name: updateWebhookTarget
fields.description: Updates a webhook target.

fields.name: upsertCustomer
fields.description: Creates or updates a customer.

fields.name: upsertCustomerGroup
fields.description: Creates or updates a customer group.

types.name: MutationError
types.description: A type indicating an error has occurred while making a mutation.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A fixed error code that can be used to handle this error, see https://www.plain.com/docs/graphql-api/error-codes for a description of each code.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: The array of fields that are impacted by this error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: An English technical description of the error. This error is usually meant to be read by a developer and not an end user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of error. Can be used to display a user friendly error message.

types.name: MutationErrorType
types.description: An enum for why the mutation failed overall.

enumValues.name: FORBIDDEN
enumValues.description: The user is not authorized to do this mutation. See `message` for details on which permissions are missing.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL
enumValues.description: An unknown internal server error occurred. Retry the mutation and if it persists, please email help@plain.com

enumValues.name: VALIDATION
enumValues.description: Input validation failed, see the `fields` for details on why the input was invalid.

types.name: MutationFieldError
types.description: A type indicating an error has occurred with a specific field in the input.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The name of the field for which the error happened.

fields.name: message
fields.description: An English technical description of the error. This error is usually meant to be read by a developer and not an end user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the error. Can be used to display a user friendly error message.

types.name: MutationFieldErrorType
types.description: An enum specific to each field, explaining why validation failed.

enumValues.name: NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: The input field referenced an entity that wasn't found.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED
enumValues.description: The field is required to be provided. String inputs may be trimmed and checked for emptiness.

enumValues.name: VALIDATION
enumValues.description: The field was provided, but didn't pass the requirements of the field. See `message` for details on why.

fields.name: nextResponseTimeMinutes
fields.description: This SLA will breach if it does not receive a next response within this many minutes.

types.name: NumberSetting
types.description: A number setting

fields.name: code
fields.description: The setting code.

fields.name: numberValue
fields.description: The value of the setting. This is named uniquely (instead of just `value`) so that the union has unique fields.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: The scope of the setting.

fields.name: activeThreadCluster
fields.description: This API is in beta and may change without notice.

fields.name: chatApp
fields.description: Get a chat app by id.

fields.name: chatAppSecret
fields.description: Get a chat app secret by chat app id.

fields.name: chatApps
fields.description: List chat apps.

fields.name: connectedDiscordChannels
fields.description: Gets all Discord channels for this workspace, which match the specified filters.

fields.name: connectedSlackChannels
fields.description: Gets all slack channels for this workspace, which match the specified filters.

fields.name: customerByExternalId
fields.description: Get a customer by its external ID. A customer's external ID is unique within a workspace.

fields.name: customerCardInstances
fields.description:
Loads the customer's card instances.

This query will return any cards that are loaded and within their expiry time.
For cards that are past their expiry or are errored it will request a load of the cards and
return a `CustomerCardInstanceLoading`.

A maximum of 25 card instances will be returned, due to only allowing 25 customer card configs.

fields.name: customerGroup
fields.description: Get a customer group by ID.

fields.name: customerGroups
fields.description: Get a paginated list of customer groups.

fields.name: generatedReplies
fields.description: This API is in beta and may change without notice.

fields.name: helpCenterArticleBySlug
fields.description: Get a help center article by its slug.

fields.name: helpCenterArticleGroupBySlug
fields.description: Get a help center article group by its slug.

fields.name: searchCustomers
fields.description:
Search for customers based on the provided query. Returned customers are sorted by how recently
they changed status (most recent first).

fields.name: searchSlackUsers
fields.description:
Searches for slack users in a slack channel based on a search term.
The search term can be part of either the slack's handle or full name.

fields.name: searchThreadSlackUsers
fields.description:
Searches for slack users in a thread based on a search term.
The search term can be part of either the slack's handle or full name.

fields.name: setting
fields.description: Gets a single setting based on the code and the scope.

fields.name: slackUser
fields.description: Gets a single slack user within a channel based on their slack user ID.

fields.name: subscriptionEventTypes
fields.description: List all the events types you can subscribe to.

fields.name: thread
fields.description: Get a thread by its ID.

fields.name: threadByExternalId
fields.description: Get a thread by its external ID. A thread's external ID is unique within a customer, hence why the customer ID is required.

fields.name: threadByRef
fields.description: Get a thread by its ref.

fields.name: threadCluster
fields.description: This API is in beta and may change without notice.

fields.name: threadClusters
fields.description: This API is in beta and may change without notice.

fields.name: threadClustersPaginated
fields.description: This API is in beta and may change without notice.

fields.name: threadSlackUser
fields.description: Gets a single slack user within a thread based on their slack user ID.

fields.name: userByEmail
fields.description:
Returns a user by email or null if the user is not found.

Deleted users are also returned, see isDeleted, deletedAt and deletedBy fields on the User type.

fields.name: userSlackChannelMemberships
fields.description:
Gets a list of Slack channels where the specified user is a member.
This is a proxy to the Slack API's users.conversations endpoint.

fields.name: webhookTarget
fields.description: Gets a webhook target.

fields.name: webhookVersions

fields.name: workflowRule

fields.name: workflowRules
fields.description: List workflow rules.

fields.name: customerCardInstance
fields.description: The reloaded customer card instance. Currently this will always be a `CustomerCardInstanceLoading` type.

inputFields.name: customerCardConfigOrders
inputFields.description: An array of ordering updates.

fields.name: customerCardConfigs
fields.description: The reordered customer card configs.

inputFields.name: fromAlternateSupportEmail
inputFields.description:
Optional field for alternate from email address. If provided, it will be used as the from address in the email.
It must match one of the workspace support email addresses (default or alternate).

fields.name: assignableBillingSeats
fields.deprecationReason: Don't use. Will be removed soon.

fields.name: requiresBillableSeat
fields.deprecationReason: Don't use. Will be removed soon.

fields.name: adjustedPrice
fields.description:
The total price delta for the remainder of the current billing period (i.e. prorated).
Could be negative (e.g. swapping member for viewer).

fields.name: dueNowPrice
fields.description:
Total amount that will be invoiced immediately for the role change.
If this is negative, we would credit the amount to your account.

fields.name: fullPrice
fields.description:
The total price delta for the entire subscription billing period (i.e. non-prorated).
Could be negative (e.g. swapping member for viewer).

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of seats.

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: Deprecated. Use fullPrice instead.

inputFields.name: timestamp
inputFields.description: When provided, this will override the timestamp of the chat. Useful when backfilling messages. Must be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: timestamp
inputFields.description: When provided, this will override the timestamp of the chat. Useful when backfilling messages. Must be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2024-10-28T18:30:00Z).

inputFields.name: fromAlternateSupportEmail
inputFields.description:
Optional field for alternate from email address. If provided, it will be used as the from address in the email.
It must match one of the workspace support email addresses (default or alternate).

inputFields.name: threadId
inputFields.description: If provided this will add the new email to an existing thread. If not provided, a new thread will be created.

fields.name: serviceIntegrationKey
fields.description: One of: zendesk, salesforce, freshdesk, helpscout-mailbox, hubspot, jira, shortcut, rootly, incidentio, github-app-oauth.

types.name: ServiceAuthorizationStatus
types.description:
The status of the service authorization. The status transitions are as follows:
PENDING_AUTH  COMPLETE_AUTH  CONNECTED  REINSTALL_REQUIRED

There is no

enumValues.name: COMPLETED_AUTH
enumValues.description:
User has completed the service authorization, but the service is not yet ready for use.
This happens when the service requires additional configuration (e.g. creating webhooks
in the service).
This is a transient state that typically lasts for a few seconds. Plain will automatically
attempt to configure the service, and transition to CONNECTED or REINSTALL_REQUIRED.

enumValues.name: CONNECTED
enumValues.description: Service authorization is connected and ready for use.

enumValues.name: PENDING_AUTH
enumValues.description: Service authorization was requested, but the user has not yet completed the authorization.

enumValues.name: REINSTALL_REQUIRED
enumValues.description:
Service authorization was revoked, this typically happen when the Plain integration is removed
from the service. Plain keeps the service authorization to allow for reconnection without
losing the service's configuration.

inputFields.name: serviceIntegrationKey
inputFields.description: One of: zendesk, salesforce, freshdesk, helpscout-mailbox, hubspot, jira, shortcut, rootly, incidentio, github-app-oauth.

fields.name: breachActions
fields.description: The actions to take when the SLA is about to breach and when it breaches.

fields.name: threadPriorityFilter
fields.description: This SLA can only be applied to a thread if it has one of these priority values.

fields.name: useBusinessHoursOnly
fields.description: If true, the SLA will only be tracked during your workspace's business hours. If false, the SLA will tracked 24/7.

inputFields.description: The actions to take when the SLA is about to breach and when it breaches.

inputFields.name: firstResponseTimeMinutes
inputFields.description: Set this to configure the firt response time SLA.

inputFields.name: nextResponseTimeMinutes
inputFields.description: Set this to configure an SLA for next responses.

inputFields.name: threadLabelTypeIdFilter
inputFields.description: This SLA can only be applied to a thread if it has one or all of these label types. If not provided, the filter is not applied.

inputFields.name: threadPriorityFilter
inputFields.description: This SLA can only be applied to a thread if it has one of these priority values. If not provided, it defaults to all priorities (0, 1, 2 and 3).

inputFields.name: useBusinessHoursOnly
inputFields.description: If true, the SLA will only be tracked during your workspace's business hours. If false, the SLA will tracked 24/7.

fields.name: achievedAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA was achieved.

fields.name: breachedAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA breached.

fields.name: completedAt

fields.name: breachedAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA breached.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA was cancelled.

fields.name: breachingAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA will breach.

fields.name: breachingAt
fields.description: The time when this SLA will breach.

fields.name: labelTypeIds
fields.description: The label type IDs that the thread needs to have in order for the SLA to be applied. Based on the 'requireAll' field.

fields.name: requireAll
fields.description: If true, the SLA will only be applied to threads that have all of the provided label types. If false, the SLA will be applied to threads that have any of the provided label types.

inputFields.name: labelTypeIds
inputFields.description: The label type IDs that the thread needs to have in order for the SLA to be applied. Based on the 'requireAll' field.

inputFields.name: requireAll
inputFields.description: If true, the SLA will only be applied to threads that have all of the provided label types. If false, the SLA will be applied to threads that have any of the provided label types.

types.name: Setting
types.description: A union of different types of settings.

types.name: SettingScopeInput
types.description: An input to specify the scope for a setting.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: An optional ID input. Depends on the type of scope if this is required.

inputFields.name: scopeType
inputFields.description: Determines the type of the scope.

types.name: SettingScopeType
types.description: An enum to describe the type of scope the setting is for.

enumValues.name: CHAT
enumValues.description:
Scope for any chat application settings
An `id` is mandatory and should be a chat application id (`liveChatApp_123`)

enumValues.name: USER
enumValues.description:
Scope for any user level settings
An `id` is not needed as it will implicitly be the authenticated user's id.

enumValues.name: USER_EMAIL_NOTIFICATIONS
enumValues.description:
Scope for the authenticated user's email notification settings.
An `id` is not needed as it will implicitly be the authenticated user's id.

enumValues.name: USER_SLACK_NOTIFICATIONS
enumValues.description:
Scope for the authenticated user's slack notification settings.
An `id` is not needed as it will implicitly be the authenticated user's id.

enumValues.name: WORKSPACE
enumValues.description:
Scope for workspace level settings for the whole workspace.
An `id` is not needed as it will implicitly be the current workspace id.

enumValues.name: WORKSPACE_DISCORD_NOTIFICATIONS
enumValues.description:
Scope for discord notifications configured for the whole workspace.
An `id` is mandatory and should be a workspace discord integration id (`wsDiscordInt_123`)

enumValues.name: WORKSPACE_SLACK_CHANNEL
enumValues.description:
Scope for slack support channel settings.
An `id` is mandatory and should be a workspace slack channel integration id (`wsSlackInt_123`)

enumValues.name: WORKSPACE_SLACK_NOTIFICATIONS
enumValues.description:
Scope for slack notifications configured for the whole workspace.
An `id` is mandatory and should be a workspace slack integration id (`wsSlackInt_123`)

types.name: SettingValueInput
types.description:
An input "union" where exactly one field may be be provided as an input.
Current API only supports booleans but as the API expands more optional fields will be added.

inputFields.name: boolean
inputFields.description: If the setting value is a boolean then this field should be set.

inputFields.name: number
inputFields.description: If the setting value is a number then this field should be set

inputFields.name: string
inputFields.description: If the setting value is a string then this field should be set.

inputFields.name: stringArray
inputFields.description: If the setting value is a string array then this field should be set.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Defaults to 24 hours ago.

inputFields.name: serviceIntegrationKey
inputFields.description: One of: zendesk, salesforce, freshdesk, helpscout-mailbox, hubspot, jira, shortcut, rootly, incidentio, github-app-oauth.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: StringArraySetting
types.description: A string array setting

fields.name: code
fields.description: The setting code.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: The scope of the setting.

fields.name: stringArrayValue
fields.description: The value of the setting. This is named uniquely (instead of just `value`) so that the union has unique fields.

types.name: StringSearchExpression
types.description:
The different ways in which a string is matched.
Exactly one of these must be provided in a single search expression.

inputFields.name: caseInsensitiveContains
inputFields.description: Case-insensitive match values containing the provided string.

types.name: StringSetting
types.description: A string setting

fields.name: code
fields.description: The setting code.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: The scope of the setting.

fields.name: stringValue
fields.description: The value of the setting. This is named uniquely (instead of just `value`) so that the union has unique fields.

inputFields.name: hasResponse
inputFields.description: Filter for threads with any survey response, regardless of the specific values

fields.name: mapsTo
fields.description: The concept this field maps to, if any. Used for automatic tier assignment.

types.name: TenantsSearchQuery
types.description: Query to search for tenants.

inputFields.name: term
inputFields.description:
The term to search for. It must be at least 2 characters long. The search is case-insensitive on these two fields:
- the tenant name (partial match)
- the tenant external id (exact match)

types.name: Thread
types.description: A thread represents a conversation with a customer, around a specific topic.

fields.name: additionalAssignees
fields.description: Additional assignees for this thread.

fields.name: assignedAt
fields.description: The datetime when this thread was last assigned to someone or something.

fields.name: assignedTo
fields.description: Who or what this thread is assigned to.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel this thread belongs to.

fields.name: channelDetails
fields.description: Details about the channel this thread is on.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The datetime when this thread was created.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The actor who created this thread.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer involved in this thread.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this thread.

fields.name: escalationDetails
fields.description: The escalation details for this thread.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: The external ID of this thread. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this thread.

fields.name: firstInboundMessageInfo
fields.description: First inbound message on the thread.

fields.name: firstOutboundMessageInfo
fields.description: First outbound message on the thread.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the thread.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: The labels attached to this thread.

fields.name: lastInboundMessageInfo
fields.description: Last inbound message received.

fields.name: lastOutboundMessageInfo
fields.description: Last outbound message received.

fields.name: links
fields.description: The links attached to this thread.

fields.name: participants
fields.description: The participants in this thread.

fields.name: previewText
fields.description: The preview text of the thread reflects the current state of the thread. As such, it might be updated when new activity happens in the thread.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority of the thread. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3, from most to least urgent.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The human-readable identifier of the thread, ie T-1234.

fields.name: serviceLevelAgreementStatusSummary
fields.description: If this thread has a linked SLA, this will inform on the status of its objectives.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this thread.

fields.name: statusChangedAt
fields.description: The datetime when the status of this thread was last changed.

fields.name: statusChangedBy
fields.description: The actor who last changed the status of this thread.

fields.name: statusDetail
fields.description: Additional details about the current thread status. For instance, how long it will be snoozed for.

fields.name: supportEmailAddresses
fields.description:
The support email addresses involved in this thread.
A support email address is either the default support email address or an alternate support email address.
A support email address is considered to be involved in a thread when any participant in the thread uses it as their email recipient.

fields.name: surveyResponse
fields.description: The survey responses for this thread.

fields.name: tenant
fields.description: The tenant this thread is associated with.

fields.name: threadDiscussions
fields.description: The thread discussions attached to this thread.

fields.name: threadFields
fields.description: The thread fields attached to this thread.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: The tier this thread is associated with. Tiers mandate the SLAs for this thread.

fields.name: timelineEntries
fields.description: All of the timeline entries in this thread.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this thread, which allows to quickly identify what it is about.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The datetime when this thread was last updated.

fields.name: updatedBy
fields.description: The actor who last updated this thread.

fields.name: escalationPath
fields.description: The escalation path this thread is associated with.

fields.name: nextEscalationPathStep
fields.description: The step this thread will be escalated to. If it is null, the thread is at the end of the escalation path.

fields.name: components
fields.description: The list of components of the event.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The datetime when this event was created.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The actor who created this event.

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The customer that this event belongs to.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the event.

fields.name: threadId
fields.description: The thread that this event belongs to.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The datetime when this event was last updated.

fields.name: updatedBy
fields.description: The actor who last updated this event.

fields.name: currentViewRank
fields.description:
The current rank of the thread link group considering groups
which match the non-ID input filters.

fields.name: defaultViewRank
fields.description:
The default rank of the thread link group which takes into account
only active groups. This rank is not affected by input filters.

fields.name: noCompany
fields.description: Metrics when the thread is not associated with any company.

inputFields.name: statuses
inputFields.description: Defaults to [TODO, IN_PROGRESS]

fields.name: noTier
fields.description: Metrics when the thread is not associated with any tier.

types.name: ThreadLinkStatus
types.description:
Represents a simplified, high-level status of a thread link which can be used for filtering and sorting.
Statuses from different external providers (e.g. Linear, Jira, Incident.io, Notion... etc) are mapped to one of these values.

enumValues.name: DONE
enumValues.description:
Indicates that the linked issue is in a state that is considered finished.
This includes granular statuses like "Completed", "Done", "Resolved", "Cancelled", ...etc.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description:
Indicates that the linked entity is in a post-start state, but not yet finished.
This includes granular statuses like "Started", "In Progress", "In Review", "Blocked", ...etc

enumValues.name: TODO
enumValues.description:
Indicates that the linked entity is in pre-start state.
This includes granular statuses like "Backlog", "Triage", "Unstarted", "Draft", "Planned", ...etc

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown or unsupported future statuses from external providers.

fields.name: messageSource
fields.description: The source through which the message came through.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The datetime when the last message was received.

fields.name: linearIssueId
fields.deprecationReason: ThreadStatusDetailLinearUpdated is no longer supported, query ThreadStatusDetailThreadLinkUpdated instead.

fields.name: statusChangedAt
fields.deprecationReason: ThreadStatusDetailLinearUpdated is no longer supported, query ThreadStatusDetailThreadLinkUpdated instead.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.deprecationReason: ThreadStatusDetailLinearUpdated is no longer supported, query ThreadStatusDetailThreadLinkUpdated instead.

fields.name: newReplyAt
fields.deprecationReason: newReplyAt is no longer supported, query Thread.lastInboundMessageInfo.timestamp instead.

inputFields.name: isMessage
inputFields.description: Only return message timeline entries.

types.name: ThreadsSearchQuery
types.description:
Query to search for threads. The search term provided is used to match against different parts of the thread:
- its title
- its messages
- the customer's name
- the customer's email

inputFields.name: term
inputFields.description: The term to search for. It must be at least 2 characters long. The search is case-insensitive.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color to assign to this tier, given by its hex code (e.g. #FABADA). This color is used in Plain's UI to represent this tier.

fields.name: defaultPriority
fields.description: Any thread created in this tier will have this priority by default, unless a different priority is specified while creating it.

fields.name: defaultThreadPriority
fields.description: Any thread created in this tier will have this priority by default, unless a different priority is specified while creating it.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: The external ID of this tier. You can use this field to store your own unique identifier for this tier. This must be unique in your workspace.

fields.name: isDefault
fields.description: If true, this tier will be applied to all threads that do not match any other tier. Only one tier can be the default tier.

fields.name: isMachineTier
fields.description: If true, this tier was automatically created based on tenant field values and should not be manually modified.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this tier.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Defaults to 24 hours ago.

types.name: UpdateCustomerCardConfigInput
types.description: For constraints and details on the fields see the `CustomerCardConfig` type.

inputFields.name: apiHeaders
inputFields.description: If provided, will replace the existing API headers. Requires the `customerCardConfigApiDetails:edit` permission.

inputFields.name: apiUrl
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the API URL. Requires the `customerCardConfigApiDetails:edit` permission.

inputFields.name: customerCardConfigId
inputFields.description: The customer card config to update.

inputFields.name: defaultTimeToLiveSeconds
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the default time to live seconds.

inputFields.name: isEnabled
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the enabled flag.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the key. Keys must be unique in a workspace.

inputFields.name: order
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the order.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: If provided, will update the title.

fields.name: customerCardConfig
fields.description: The updated customer card config.

inputFields.name: companyIdentifier
inputFields.description: The identifier of the company we want to update the customer with. Pass null if you want to remove the company from the customer.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the customer we want to update the company for.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of machine user. Defaults to API_USER if not specified.

inputFields.name: breachActions
inputFields.description: The actions to take when the SLA is about to breach and when it breaches.

inputFields.name: firstResponseTimeMinutes
inputFields.description: This SLA will breach if it does not receive a first response within this many minutes. May only be provided if the service level agreement is a first response time SLA.

inputFields.name: nextResponseTimeMinutes
inputFields.description: This SLA will breach if it does not receive a next response within this many minutes. May only be provided if the service level agreement is a next response time SLA.

inputFields.name: serviceLevelAgreementId
inputFields.description: The ID of the SLA to update.

inputFields.name: threadLabelTypeIdFilter
inputFields.description: This SLA can only be applied to a thread if it has one or all of these label types. If not provided, the filter is not applied.

inputFields.name: threadPriorityFilter
inputFields.description: This SLA can only be applied to a thread if it has one of these priority values. If not provided, it defaults to all priorities (0, 1, 2 and 3).

inputFields.name: useBusinessHoursOnly
inputFields.description: If true, the SLA will only be tracked during your workspace's business hours. If false, the SLA will tracked 24/7.

types.name: UpdateSettingInput

Returns the updated setting or an error.

inputFields.name: payload

fields.name: additionalLegacyRoles

fields.name: avatarUrl

fields.name: email

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: The full name e.g. Grace Hopper.

fields.name: labels

fields.name: publicName

fields.name: role

fields.name: slackIdentities

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email associated with this user. Email is unique per user.

fields.name: fullName

fields.name: publicName
fields.description: A short name for use in UI e.g. Grace.

fields.name: alternateSupportEmailAddresses
fields.description:
The list of alternate email addresses that can be used to send emails to and from the workspace.
Limited to 5.

e.g. [info@plain.com, help@plain.com].

fields.description: This URL will only be available after the file has been uploaded.

fields.name: expiresAt

fields.description: The role that the invite will assign on workspace joining. This will replace the roles field.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: The roles that the invite will assign on workspace joining.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the invite was updated.

fields.name: updatedBy
fields.description: Who updated this invite.

fields.name: usingBillingRotaSeat
fields.description: Whether the user would be assigned a billing rota seat upon joining.

fields.name: workspace
fields.description: The workspace they are being invited to.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
